DIALOGUE BEFORE: NPCMHonestDan: I'm going to find those survivors. Or die trying.
RESPONSE TEXT: Hell of a job, right?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: It seems like you actually care about this job, though.
SCRIPT NOTES: It's his job to put his life on the line, darkly amused at this

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: It seems like you actually care about this job, though.
RESPONSE TEXT: My pockets would be a lot heavier if I didn't have any sentimentality.
You see enough shit, though, and either you want to muck it out or make it worse.
DIALOGUE AFTER: HonestDan: Well, the survivors won't rescue themselves.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Takes a special type of person to be paid to die.
RESPONSE TEXT: Tell me about it.
DIALOGUE AFTER: HonestDan: Well, the survivors won't rescue themselves.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Here's hoping you got dental.
RESPONSE TEXT: You are all manner of strange.
DIALOGUE AFTER: HonestDan: Well, the survivors won't rescue themselves.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What are synths, anyway?
RESPONSE TEXT: *grunt* You must be new around here. Synths are synthetic people made by the Institute.
Real advanced machines. Might as well be human because no one can tell the difference between them and us.
Everyone in the Commonwealth is afraid of Synths, and the Institute.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: It seems like you actually care about this job, though.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What are synths, anyway?
RESPONSE TEXT: Ask three different people, you'll get three different answers to that. Wildly different.
Most people believe the Institute's behind every manner of ill in the Commonwealth.
Sister disappears or lose your Brahmin, the Institute. Settlement murdered in the middle of the night, the Institute.
But I've never met a single person that has proof about any of that.
But there's no denying synths are real enough. So the Institute's infiltrating us and I doubt they're doing that for our own good.
DIALOGUE AFTER: HonestDan: Well, the survivors won't rescue themselves.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You see enough shit, though, and either you want to muck it out or make it worse.
RESPONSE TEXT: Well, the survivors won't rescue themselves.
They knew we were coming. Must've tripped some sort of sensor. I bet you 50 caps there's a lot more where they came from.
No sign of the Caravan yet. They got to be holding them someplace. What the hell are they doing here, any way?
Looks like they repurposed some old world sewers. I don't like the sight lines here. Plenty of opportunities for an ambush.
SCRIPT NOTES: Almost muttering to himself, on high alert

RESPONSE TEXT: Some sort of bridge. Must be another way around.
So they gather people up. Torture them. And all for the SAFE Test? The sick bastards need to be put down.
DIALOGUE AFTER: HonestDan: Cell's empty. Dammit.

RESPONSE TEXT: Meeting room. Great. They got to have more holding cells somewhere. I feel it in my gut. Stockton's people were here.
SCRIPT NOTES: On a mission, thinking on his feet

RESPONSE TEXT: Got a clearing up ahead. I got your 6. Who knows where more of the bastards will pop up.
Turret control terminal over there. I don't suppose you're good with those things?
SCRIPT NOTES: Pointing something out, hoping the player is tech savvy

DIALOGUE BEFORE: HonestDan: So they gather people up. Torture them. And all for the SAFE Test? The sick bastards need to be put down.
RESPONSE TEXT: Cell's empty. Dammit.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DoctorChambers: Let us continue our work and we will pay you the bounty you would be giving up. But we keep Stockton's synth.
RESPONSE TEXT: Like hell I will. I made a deal with Old Man Stockton. And I plan on making good.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DoctorChambers: Does Mr. Dan speak for you, as well? Or are you willing to listen to reason?
SCRIPT NOTES: Firm, angry - he's totally down with shooting her / Irritated

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I found out about a Compound. The caravan survivors may be there.
RESPONSE TEXT: I got one thing. They deny up and down that Stockton's men ever came here. But they most certainly did.
SCRIPT NOTES: Emphasize "one thing" - he's caught them in a lie, now he's being persistent

RESPONSE TEXT: There's no reason to bald face lie to me if they're not hiding something. I'll keep poking around.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I found out about a Compound. The caravan survivors may be there.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I found out about a Compound. The caravan survivors may be there.
RESPONSE TEXT: No. I still have no proof.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I found out about a Compound. The caravan survivors may be there.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: So, what's the Institute?
RESPONSE TEXT: You must be new around here. Synths are synthetic people made by the Institute.
Real advanced machines. Might as well be human because no one can tell the difference between them and us.
Everyone in the Commonwealth is afraid of synths, and the Institute... but come to mention it...
I've been here a long while, and nobody's even breathed a word about them. That is odd.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I found out about a Compound. The caravan survivors may be there.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: So, what's the Institute?
RESPONSE TEXT: They keep the barracks locked up tight. Find a way in and I'm sure you'll turn up something. But leads could be anywhere, really.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I found out about a Compound. The caravan survivors may be there.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I found a map that shows some sort of Compound nearby.
RESPONSE TEXT: No. If Covenant doesn't pan out then I don't know where to start. I'll cross that road if I have to.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I found out about a Compound. The caravan survivors may be there.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I found out about a Compound. The caravan survivors may be there.
RESPONSE TEXT: Great, now we just need to find it. If anyone would know where this Compound is it'd be Jacob. He runs this town.
But he doesn't have the best memory. I saw him once reading a slip of paper while entering his password. Maybe you can find that?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I found out about a Compound. The caravan survivors may be there.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I found out about a Compound. The caravan survivors may be there.
RESPONSE TEXT: We need to find out where the Compound is. My best guess is it's on Jacob's terminal.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I found out about a Compound. The caravan survivors may be there.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: So, what's the Institute?
RESPONSE TEXT: Hmm. Now that you mention it... people are always gabbing about synths. Or the Institute.
But here... not one word. But, hell, this whole place is a bucket full of strange.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I found out about a Compound. The caravan survivors may be there.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I found a map that shows some sort of Compound nearby.
RESPONSE TEXT: Huh. Not much to go on. I'll see if I can figure out anything about this... Compound.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I found out about a Compound. The caravan survivors may be there.

RESPONSE TEXT: The job was to rescue her, asshole.
SCRIPT NOTES: Raised volume - Filled with rage, said before attacking the player

RESPONSE TEXT: A caravan came a few days back. Worked for Old Man Stockton. You saw them, right?
DIALOGUE AFTER: DanIntroPartner: I already told you: I don't recollect. We get a lot of traffic.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DanIntroPartner: I already told you: I don't recollect. We get a lot of traffic.
RESPONSE TEXT: This isn't Diamond City. A caravan of five comes through, you'd remember.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DanIntroPartner: Then they must not have come through. Say, wouldn't you rather have a lemonade?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DanIntroPartner: Then they must not have come through. Say, wouldn't you rather have a lemonade?
RESPONSE TEXT: My job here isn't drinking lemonade. I know for a fact they came here. Why the brush off?
DIALOGUE AFTER: DanIntroPartner: I want to help, mister, but I don't really recollect.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DanIntroPartner: I want to help, mister, but I don't really recollect.
RESPONSE TEXT: Mark my words, I'll get to the bottom of this.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'll take the deal.
RESPONSE TEXT: I wish you hadn't said that.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DoctorChambers: Excellent. You'll find that Covenant has more to offer since we've come to this understanding. Goodbye.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: GuardManny: Blythe. Hey Blythe!
RESPONSE TEXT: Torture? They're sick. Just give me the signal.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Blythe: Yes. What is it, Manny?
SCRIPT NOTES: Loud stage whisper to the player - Shocked, spoiling to kick their ass

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DoctorChambers: I will make you a deal. I pay you handsomely. And you let me dispose of our last remaining synth test subject, Amelia Stockton. Then I can continue my work.
RESPONSE TEXT: I've had my fill of crazy on this contract. No deal.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DoctorChambers: Fortunate for me, I wasn't talking to you.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DoctorChambers: Fortunate for me, I wasn't talking to you.
RESPONSE TEXT: You side with this nut job and we're going to have a serious, deadly, problem.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Continue your work, then.
SCRIPT NOTES: Doesn't think the player will do it - but steel in tone / Angry

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Are you threatening me, Dan?

I took this contract and I will honor it. Even if I have to kill you to do it.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Continue your work, then.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: They took the survivors to a Compound.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: No. Still looking.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You? You're from Covenant? Yeah, and I'm the mayor of Diamond City.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You're as bad as the rest of these idiots.
RESPONSE TEXT: I signed on with Old Man Stockton to find his lost caravan. What's left of it is just outside of town.

RESPONSE TEXT: Their last stop was here so I've trying to put together the story. But I keep getting the run around.
DIALOGUE AFTER: HonestDan: Got a proposal for you. Help me find Stockton's people and we split the reward. At least one survivor walked out of that massacre.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: HonestDan: Their last stop was here so I've trying to put together the story. But I keep getting the run around.

RESPONSE TEXT: And I intend to make good on my contract.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: If I help you I want something up front.

DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Sounds fair. I'm in.

RESPONSE TEXT: So Stockton gets his daughter and we get paid. Not a bad day.
